newsitem.title: USA: Cold, snow forecast for U.S. winter wheat regions.
newsitem.headline: Cold, snow forecast for U.S. winter wheat regions.

text.p: Winter wheat fields will probably remain frozen this week but meteorologists said another snow storm will provide some protection from winter kill.

"We should see snow in the central Plains tonight and tomorrow, moving east Wednesday," said Joel Burgio, meteorologist with Weather Services Corp. "That should provide some protective snow cover for wheat."
Temperatures remained bitterly cold Monday morning. Goodland, Kan., reported a low temperature of -17 Farenheit and Indianapolis dipped to -12 F.
Temperatures should average five to 15 degrees below normal through Sunday, said Craig Solberg, meteorologist with Frees-Notis.
"It looks like (the cold) is going to last through this coming weekend," Solberg said. "There will be some snow across western Kansas and Nebraska early this week."
He also predicted light snow across the soft red winter wheat growing regions of Illinois, Indiana and Ohio.
Those areas received moderate snowfall over the weekend which lessened the risk of winter kill, Burgio noted.
